Sudden increase in resource utilization.Data: Windows Event ID 24, Application/Service Specific Logs
Sudden increase in resource utilization.Action: Monitor Windows Event Logs (e.g., Perfmon related events), system performance counters (CPU, memory, network IO), and application logs on critical servers. Use time series analysis to detect significant deviations from baseline resource utilization and correlate with error rates or service failures reported in application logs. Identify processes consuming excessive resources.

Anomalous network traffic patterns (e.g..Data: Zeek conn.log, Zeek http.log, Zeek weird.log
Anomalous network traffic patterns (e.g..Action: Analyze Zeek conn.log, http.log, and weird.log for connections targeting service ports on critical endpoints. Calculate connection rates per source IP and overall. Use statistical methods (e.g., outlier detection, correlation analysis between source IPs and connection volume) to identify unusually high connection rates, unusual protocol usage, or other traffic anomalies directed at specific endpoint services.
